prompt: <description>**Part 1: A simple, flat, rectangular shape with a hole in the center.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0061, 0.0] Now, create the 2D sketch for this part on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Sketch face_1 contains three loops: loop_1, loop_2, and loop_3. Loop_1 consists of four arcs: arc_1, arc_2, arc_3, and arc_4, arranged in a clockwise direction. Here is the detailed information about these arcs: - arc_1 starts at (0.1749, 0.0), ends at (0.5751, 0.0), and the midpoint is at (0.375, 0.0303). - arc_2 starts at (0.5751, 0.0), ends at (0.5751, 0.2577), and the midpoint is at (0.75, 0.1289). - arc_3 starts at (0.5751, 0.2577), ends at (0.1749, 0.2577), and the midpoint is at (0.375, 0.2274). - arc_4 starts at (0.1749, 0.2577), ends at (0.1749, 0.0), and the midpoint is at (0.0, 0.1289). Loop_2 is a circle with the center at (0.1349, 0.1289) and has a radius of 0.059. Loop_3 is a circle with the center at (0.6151, 0.1289) and has a radius of 0.059. The sketch does not have any constraints, which is a requirement for this particular shape. Now, scale the 2D sketch using the sketch_scale factor of 0.75. Follow this by transforming the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to generate the 3D solid model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.0337 and there is no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. The result will be a simple, flat, rectangular shape with a height of 0.0337, and two holes in the center.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Hollow Center** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] This part will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a hollow center. The top and bottom faces are parallel, and the front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The sides of the prism are all equal in length. The hollow center is a smaller rectangular prism with the same dimensions as the outer prism. The hollow center is positioned in the center of the outer prism. First, draw the 2D sketch for the outer prism. *Sketch, Face 1:* - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7227, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.7227, 0.0], End Point [0.7227, 0.7444] - Line 3: Start Point [0.7227, 0.7444], End Point [0.0, 0.7444] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.7444], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This sketch has 4 lines, forming a single loop and one face. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using the `sketch_scale` parameter: `0.7444`. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate_system. Extrude the 2D sketch by the `extrude_depth_towards_normal` parameter value `0.75` to create a 3D model for the outer prism. Now, create a new 2D sketch for the hollow center prism aligned with the first 2D sketch. *Sketch, Face 1:* - Loop 1 (Reuse the first loop from the outer prism sketch): - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7227, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.7227, 0.0], End Point [0.7227, 0.7444] - Line 3: Start Point [0.7227, 0.7444], End Point [0.0, 0.7444] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.7444], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This sketch also has 4 lines, forming a single loop and one face. After creating the 2D sketch for the hollow center prism, follow the same process to scale, transform, and extrude as for the outer prism. This time, use an `extrude_depth_towards_normal` parameter value of `-0.75` to create the hollow center. The final shape is achieved by combining both the outer and hollow centers through a boolean operation to create the desired three-dimensional rectangular prism with a hollow center.</description>
